Most of the time, people play d4, giving more chance to attack, but it's always nice to vary.
I always prefer to play the flanchetto when I'm playing black. The dragon is not always the most reliable defense in the Sicilian, but I think it can give some great attacking chances.

I always like to play h6 when I have the chance, it can be really useful. It give can help for a king side attack or give space for my king. Now I will have an idea what white want to do with his bishop.

?! I think e4 was a must at this time. White lack of space to create some offensive.
?! It was a very instinctive sacrifice. White cannot answer with Nxa2 because of Qxb2 15.Kd1 Qxa2. The only solution for white was to play b3.
